channel.title: RSS Feed for kepano
channel.description: RSS feed of the latest tweets from kepano.

item.title: "Exploring Color Mixing: Ink vs. Digital Screens"
item.description:
Ink on paper is a subtractive process whereas LCD and OLED screens use additive color. Replicating the effect of mixing pigments digitally is difficult. pic.twitter.com/fWVphwYZ5L

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Introducing Flexoki: A Striking Inky Color Scheme
item.description:
Flexoki, an inky color scheme for prose and codehttps://t.co/Fxcz6HJFIs

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Flexoki 2.0 Launches with 88 New Watercolor-Inspired Colors
item.description:
Flexoki 2.0 introduces 88 new colors that feel like watercolor pigments on paper.

This is a continuation of my attempt to bring the feeling of analog color to digital emissive screens.

Flexoki 1.0 only provided the a range of values for the grayscale colors. What I have been… pic.twitter.com/ol4LDMl6Ce

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Flexoki 2.0 Enhances Color Vibrancy and Warmth
item.description:
Flexoki 2.0 adds a full range of values for every color.

The feeling of pigment on paper is emulated by exponentially increasing intensity as colors get lighter or darker. This makes colors feel vibrant and warm, rather than washed out. pic.twitter.com/OMI6iRCk6K

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Navigating the Balance of Science and Art"
item.description:
Flexoki has been a battle between my competing desires in science and art. One part of my brain searches for reliability and precision, while another part searches for those elusive imperfections that remind us what feels real.

I hope you find it useful. https://t.co/EQ6f8Lsv82

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: Designing Flexoki 2.0: A New Color Tool
item.description:
Here's a little tool I built to design Flexoki 2.0. I wanted artistic control over ramping while still interpolating colors programmatically with Oklab.

In the future it could be used to create more hues and emulate watercolor pigment types within the Flexoki color space. pic.twitter.com/3UwH0VwEkY

— kepano (@kepano) January 9, 2025

item.title: Emphasizing File Control Over Applications for Lasting Digital Artifacts
item.description:
File over app

File over app is a philosophy: if you want to create digital artifacts that last, they must be files you can control, in formats that are easy to retrieve and read. Use tools that give you this freedom.

File over app is an appeal to tool makers: accept that all… pic.twitter.com/DUhRU7HkYv

— kepano (@kepano) July 2, 2023

item.title: Transcending Reality: The Purpose of Every Camera
item.description:
the purpose of every camera is to transcend reality · to convert a moment into a memory · to make the physical ethereal · when scuffs and scars embroider the body it is the fulfillment of a search for the ragged edge of ephemerality https://t.co/JmLCGQN4Xp

— kepano (@kepano) January 11, 2025

item.title: Sony RX100V: My All-Time Favorite Camera
item.description:
I have had dozens of cameras but the Sony RX100V is my favorite camera I have ever owned:

- tiny, fits in any pocket
- has an excellent pop-up viewfinder
- starts shooting faster than opening an app
- goes down to f1.8, ideal for low depth of field, fast moving subjects, low… pic.twitter.com/OHGjmtxXkR

— kepano (@kepano) January 10, 2025

there can never be too much frangipane pic.twitter.com/jgL8Ic7w2o

— kepano (@kepano) January 6, 2025

item.title: "Creators Need Their Own Space Beyond YouTube and Platforms"
item.description:
You have to think of YouTube and other platforms as a mechanism for distribution, not a source of truth.

If you're a creator it's essential to have your own place on the web were you can host and publish anything without fear that it will be taken down for any reason — even… https://t.co/4GpHaGG8OF

— kepano (@kepano) January 6, 2025

item.title: "Quick Review: Gemini 2.0 Flash – Fast and Free!"
item.description:
my quick review of Gemini 2.0 Flash released today — it's really fast, and free (for now?)

Feels on par with Claude Haiku 3.5 in my Web Clipper testing. Here's an example: pic.twitter.com/saWpOMrrBL

— kepano (@kepano) December 11, 2024

item.title: "Flexoki 2.0 Features Exponential Colorfulness for Natural Pigment"
item.description:
The darker values in Flexoki 2.0 also follow this exponential colorfulness to maintain a highly pigmented, natural feeling. pic.twitter.com/BLrcIjqfUI

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Flexoki: Vibrant Colors That Emulate Pigment on Paper"
item.description:
The problem is that using opacity to lighten a color makes it appear washed out.

Flexoki emulates the feeling of pigment on paper by exponentially increasing intensity as colors get lighter or darker. This makes the colors feel vibrant and warm, like watercolor. pic.twitter.com/KYhBeOcXcA

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: The Magic of Mastering Skills with Time
item.description:
one fun thing about getting older is simply the raw amount of time you've had to invest 10,000 hours into multiple different skills

if you're curious and carve a path through the skill tree, your skills become second nature and intertwine in ways that can seem magical https://t.co/zEEYZvHsQR

— kepano (@kepano) January 7, 2025

item.title: "Create Your Own Space: Build on the Web"
item.description:
You built a house on someone else's land, and then they tore it down.

Build a house on your own land. From there you can create roads, bridges, tunnels to other people's land.

On the web land is infinite. You can make your own land.

— kepano (@kepano) January 6, 2025
